Nominal.definition: existing or being something in name or form but usually not in reality [defenses…raised by the corporation as defendant in a derivative suit "R. C. Clark"] 2
Nominal.origin: [defenses…raised by the corporation as defendant in a derivative suit "R. C. Clark"]

1.definition: existing or being something in name or form but usually not in reality [defenses…raised by the corporation as defendant in a derivative suit "R. C. Clark"]

2.definition: being so small or trivial as to be a mere token [charging a fee]

sub_terms.a: equal to the annual rate of simple interest that would obtain if interest were not compounded when in fact it is compounded and paid for periods of less than a year
sub_terms.b: equal to the percentage by which a repaid loan exceeds the principal borrowed with no adjustment made for inflation compare
